org.diirt.graphene

Class SparklineGraph2DRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.diirt.graphene.Graph2DRenderer<SparklineGraph2DRendererUpdate>
      • org.diirt.graphene.SparklineGraph2DRenderer

  • public class SparklineGraph2DRenderer
extends Graph2DRenderer<SparklineGraph2DRendererUpdate>
    Creates a renderer that is capable of drawing a sparkline graph.

    A sparkline graph

    • Displays a line
    • Does not have axes labels
    • Does not have scales display on the axes
    • Often draws small circles at important values on the line
    • Important values are:
      • First Value
      • Last Value
      • Maximum Value
      • Minimum Value
    • Often maintains a high width to height aspect ratio. This can be manually setting the appropriate image width and height, or can be applied in the code through the aspectRatio. The aspect ratio should be set so that the line of the sparkline never has a slope greater than 45-degrees.
    Author:
    asbarber, jkfeng, sjdallst

    • Field Detail

      • supportedInterpolationScheme

        public static List<InterpolationScheme> supportedInterpolationScheme
        The set of interpolation schemes that are supported by the SparklineGraph2DRenderer. The interpolation schemes supported are NEAREST_NEIGHBOR, LINEAR, and CUBIC.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SparklineGraph2DRenderer

        public SparklineGraph2DRenderer(int imageWidth,
                                int imageHeight)
        Creates a new sparkline graph renderer. Will draw a circle at the max value, min value, and last value.
        Parameters:
        imageWidth - the graph width in pixels
        imageHeight - the graph height in pixels

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(Graphics2D g,
                 Point2DDataset data)
        Draws the graph on the given graphics context. The render process is:
        • Set aspect ratio
        • Calculate data and plot ranges
        • Calculates the region for the graph
        • Draws the background
        • Draws the line
        • Draw circles if necessary
        A circle is drawn at the max value and min value. A circle is drawn at the first value and last value. Each circle is drawn at 70% transparency. If two circles are set to draw at the same value, only one circle is drawn. If there is overlap, first/last values are drawn instead of max/min values.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics on which to display the data
        data - the data to display

      • drawCircle

        protected void drawCircle(Graphics2D g,
                          Point2DDataset data,
                          int index,
                          Color color)
        Draws a circle of a certain color at a certain position. The pixel position is determined from the data value. The data value is found by the 'index' element in 'data'.
        Parameters:
        g - graphic context to draw (where circles are drawn)
        data - set of data that is graphed
        index - position in the data set where the circle is drawn (index position)
        color - color of circle that is drawn

      • createShape

        protected Shape createShape(double x,
                            double y,
                            double size)
        Creates a circle shape at the given position with given size.
        Parameters:
        x - x position of shape
        y - y position of shape
        size - diameter of circle
        Returns:
        ellipse (circle) shape

      • processScaledValue

        protected void processScaledValue(int index,
                                  double valueX,
                                  double valueY,
                                  double scaledX,
                                  double scaledY)
        Operations for every value in data as it is processed. This checks whether each new value is an important index. An important index is if this y-value is a maximum, minimum, first, or last. Note: this y-value is always the last value.
        Overrides:
        processScaledValue in class Graph2DRenderer<SparklineGraph2DRendererUpdate>
        Parameters:
        index - element position in data set
        valueX - x value being processed
        valueY - y value being processed
        scaledX - x value scaled by data
        scaledY - y value scaled by data

        public void update(SparklineGraph2DRendererUpdate update)
        Applies the update to the renderer.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • getMaxIndex

        public int getMaxIndex()
        The index corresponding to the maximum y-value. If there are multiple maximums, the greatest index is returned.
        Returns:
        index of maximum

      • getMinIndex

        Returns:
        index of the minimum

        Returns:

      • getLastIndex

        Returns:

      • getMaxValue

        public double getMaxValue()
        The maximum y-value in the list of data. If there are multiple maximum values, the last maximum (determined by the greatest index) is the value returned.
        Returns:
        The data value of the maximum

      • getMinValue

        public double getMinValue()
        Gets the minimum y-value in the list of data. If there are multiple minimum values, the last minimum (determined by the greatest index) is the value returned.
        Returns:
        The data value of the minimum
